column4: hello, df command reports that "/run" is 100% in use, what can I do to fix this?
so is this a problem I need to fix? or this is normal?
its normal.. why are you even worried aboiut it?

because I am trying to run jenkins and it fails to start with a message in logs saying "no space left on device" I am sure I have enough free space everywhere, when I checked df, only /run is 100% used so I thought it can be related
/run/ is a special filesystem in ram
yes, I understand this, my question is that, is this related to my problem that jenkins report that there is no space left on disk or not? and if it is, how can I have more space for this tmpfs?
no idea if its related or not..  no idea what jenkins is..
don't worry about what jenkins is, can I have more space for this /run fs? how?
no idea.. i dont see why the app would care about /run/
it seems the app is extracting some files to start running and it seems it is using this path :-S
a read of --> http://askubuntu.com/questions/169495/what-are-run-lock-and-run-shm-used-for   shows that /tmp MAY be using /run
i would guess thats what its trying to use
so move /tmp/ to a real partiion perhaps
ok, solved it by configuring the app to extract its files to another path (/tmp) instead of /var/run/
